td.content: s:58 year old F presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (13 min LOC). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 30 mph on impact. pt c/o mild vomiting, moderate nausea, severe headache and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 153 cm, Weight 70 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:female aged 58 Ys presents for 6 days f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 13 min). she denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. Furthermore, she has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). she has resumed usual state of function. describes drinking an average of 12 beers a week for about 6 days in her past she denies smoking o:Height 154 cm, Weight 71.4 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 82, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=95,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=42.1,Reaction Time=0.51, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,
